properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 10 at 2:59AM CST until January 11 at 6:00AM CST by NWS La Crosse WI
properties.description:
...Multiple Rounds of Accumulating Snowfall Through Saturday Night...

.A winter storm will bring multiple rounds of snow to parts of the
region late this afternoon through Saturday night. The first
round is expected late this afternoon through late tonight across
parts of northeast Iowa into southwest Wisconsin. Accumulations of
2 to 4 inches are expected, with potential for locally higher
amounts in a narrow band. There likely will be a sharp northern
cut-off in accumulating snow.

Another period of accumulating snowfall is possible Saturday
afternoon into Saturday night, with the potential for up to 6
inches of accumulation over parts of southwest into central
Wisconsin.

If you have any travel plans later today through the weekend,
please stay up to date on the latest forecast information.

* WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow expected. Total
snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches, with locally higher
amounts possible. For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy snow
possible. Total snow accumulations of up to 6 inches possible.
Winds could gust as high as 35 mph.

* WHERE...Grant County.

* WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 3 PM this
afternoon to 6 AM CST Saturday. For the Winter Storm Watch,
from Saturday afternoon through late Saturday night.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous
conditions could impact the evening commute today.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 3 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 6 AM CST SATURDAY... ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH LATE SATURDAY NIGHT
